metadata.title: CVE-2024-29040 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
After deserializing the quote info it was not checked whetherthe magic number in the attest is equal TPM2_GENERATED_VALUE.So an malicious attacker could generate arbitrary quote datawhich was not detected by Fapi_VerifyQuote.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-29040` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtss2-esys-3.0.2-0 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-fapi1 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-mu0 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-rc0 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-sys1 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-tcti-cmd0 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-tcti-mssim0 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-tcti-swtpm0 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
libtss2-tctildr0 - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tpm2-tss package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.0-1ubuntu1.1').
